intro: Cedronella canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands cedronella, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fragrant, small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the unique climate of the region. It has finely divided leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. Cedronella canariensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
